pyCE.oscillons package¶

Module contents¶

class pyCE.oscillons.bubble(asymmetry_factor, dimension, N)[source]¶
class pyCE.oscillons.oscillon(asymmetry_factor=0.0, dimension=3, N=1500, radius_max=45, radius_MIB=44, delta_MIB=0.5, radius_cap=42, tol=1e-08, dissipation=0.8, courant_factor=0.5)[source]¶

Oscillon environment class

Creates an environment in which to simulate an oscillon. Sets up the lattice with an MIB coordinate system. Set’s up the potential, using the Kolb and Turner parametrization.

First create an environment:

osc_env = oscillon(KWARGS)

Then initialize a field:

fields = osc_env.initialize_field(KWARGS)

Run the simulation:

osc_env.simulate_oscillon(fields,KWARGS)
Parameters:
  • asymmetry_factor (float, K&T dimensionless potential, epsilon, DEFAULT: 0)
  • dimension (int, number of SPATIAL dimensions, DEFAULT: 3)
  • N (int, size of spatial lattice, DEFAULT: 1500)
  • radius_max (float, maximum radius of spatial lattice DEFAULT: 30)
  • radius_MIB (float, radius at which coordinates get boosted DEFAULT: 29)
  • delta_MIB (float, width of boost region DEFAULT: .5)
  • radius_cap (float, set boundary of oscillon DEFAULT: 20)
  • tol (float, tolerance of iterative scheme in timestep DEFAULT: \(10^{-8}\))
  • dissipation (float, strength of dissipation DEFAULT: 1.0)
  • courant_factor (float, ratio of \(dt/dx\) DEFAULT: 0.5)
Yields:
  • E (Energy history of the oscillon)
  • core (Core value history)
  • time (Array of time values for energy/core histories)

Notes

The value of \(\omega\) is larger than 5.

energy(T)[source]¶
initialize_field(field_type='gaussian', *params)[source]¶

Field types supported:

gaussian - use a single parameter to describe the radius of the
gaussian. Note the radius = Sqrt(2)*sigma
